targetString: Ngaphezu kokuhlola okudingekayo ukuze kufakwe umgomo noma umuthi olwa negciwane omusha emtholampilo okokuqala ngqa, abaklami kumelwe baqikelele ukuthi noma ibuphi ubungozi besikhathi eside noma obungamahlalakhona buyalungiswa, okubandakanya imiphumela yamasistimu abengahloliwe ngaphambilini (ukukhulelwa, ukukhiqiza kabusha, amasosha omzimba, phakathi kokunye).

sourceString: In the United States, this process is called a "new drug application" or NDA.
targetString: E-United States, le nqubo ibizwa ngokuthi yi-"new drug application" noma i-NDA.

sourceString: A clinical trial design in progress may be modified as an "adaptive design" if accumulating data in the trial provide early insights about positive or negative efficacy of the treatment.
targetString: Ucwaningo lwezokwelapha olusaklanywa lungase luchazwe ngokuthi "umklamo ovumelana nezimo" uma ukuqongelela idatha ocwaningweni kunikeza ulwazi olusha ngokusebenza okuhle noma okungekuhle komuthi.

sourceString: The global Solidarity and European Discovery trials of hospitalized people with severe COVID-19 infection apply adaptive design to rapidly alter trial parameters as results from the four experimental therapeutic strategies emerge.
targetString: Ucwaningo lomhlaba wonke lwe-Solidarity and European Discovery lwabantu abasezibhedlela abanegciwane elibi le-COVID-19 lusebenzisa umklamo osebenzisekayo ukuze usheshe ushintshe izici zocwaningo njengomphumela wokuba khona kwezindlela zokwelapha ezine ezicwaningwayo.

sourceString: Adaptive designs within ongoing Phase II-III clinical trials on candidate therapeutics may shorten trial durations and use fewer subjects, possibly expediting decisions for early termination or success, and coordinating design changes for a specific trial across its international locations.
targetString: Imiklamo evumelana nezimo phakathi nocwaningo lwezokwelapha Lwesigaba II-III kubantu abelashwayo inganciphisa isikhathi socwaningo futhi isebenzise abantu abambalwa, mhlawumbe kunqunywe ukumiswa ngaphambi kwesikhathi noma ukuphumelela, nokuxhumanisa ushintsho lomklamo locwaningo oluthile kuzo zonke izindawo emhlabeni jikelele.

sourceString: Most novel drug candidates (NCEs) fail during drug development, either because they have unacceptable toxicity or because they simply do not prove efficacy on the targeted disease, as shown in Phase II-III clinical trials.
targetString: Amakhendidethi amaningi omuthi omusha (ama-NCE) ayehluleka phakathi nokusungulwa komuthi, kungaba ngenxa yokuthi anobungozi obungamukeleki noma ngenxa yokuthi nje awabonakali efaneleka esifweni eselashwayo, njengoba kuboniswe Esigabeni II-III socwaningo lwezokwelapha.

sourceString: The high failure rates associated with pharmaceutical development are referred to as an "attrition rate", requiring decisions during the early stages of drug development to "kill" projects early to avoid costly failures.
targetString: Amanani okwehluleka okukhulu ahlobene nokusungulwa kwemithi abizwa ngokuthi "isilinganiso sobuthaka", okudinga izinqumo phakathi nezigaba zokuqala zokusungulwa komuthi ukuze "kubulawe" amaphrojekthi kusenesikhathi ukuze kugwenywe ukwehluleka okuyizindleko.

sourceString: One 2010 study assessed both capitalized and out-of-pocket costs for bringing a single new drug to market as about US$1.8 billion and $870 million, respectively.
targetString: Olunye ucwaningo lwango-2010 lwahlola kokubili izindleko eziqongelelwe nezikhokhelwe zokufaka umuthi omusha owodwa emakethe okwaba amabhiliyoni angu-US$1.8 nezigidi ezingu-$870, ngokulandelana.

sourceString: A median cost estimate of 2015-16 trials for development of 10 anti-cancer drugs was $648 million.
targetString: Isillinganiso semidiya esindleko zocwaningo luka-2015-16 ekusungulweni kwemithi elwa nomdlavuza engu-10 saba izigidi ezingu-$648.

sourceString: In a 2016 review of 106 drug candidates assessed through clinical trials, the total capital expenditure for a manufacturer having a drug approved through successful Phase III trials was $2.6 billion (in 2013 dollars), an amount increasing at an annual rate of 8.5%.
targetString: Ekubuyekezeni kwango-2016 kwamakhendidethi omuthi angu-106 ahlolwa ocwaningweni lwezokwelapha, ingqikithi yezindleko eziyinhloko zomklami onomuthi ogunyazwe ngocwaningo oluphumelele Lwesigaba III yaba amabhiliyoni angu-$2.6 (ngamadola ango-2013), inani elinyuka ngesilinganiso saminyaka yonke esingu-8.5%.

sourceString: Seven trials were evaluating repurposed drugs already approved to treat malaria, including four studies on hydroxychloroquine or chloroquine phosphate.
targetString: Ucwaningo oluyisikhombisa beluhlola imithi esetshenziswa kabusha esigunyaziwe kakade ekwelapheni umalaleveva, okubandakanya ucwaningo olune lwe-hydroxychloroquine noma i-chloroquine phosphate.

sourceString: Repurposed antiviral drugs make up most of the Chinese research, with 9 Phase III trials on remdesivir across several countries due to report by the end of April.
targetString: Imithi elwa negciwane esetshenziswa kabusha iyingxenye enkulu yocwaningo lwaseChina, futhi ucwaningo olungu-9 Lwesigaba III lwe-remdesivir emazweni amaningana luzokhipha umbiko ngasekupheleni kuka-April.

sourceString: Led by the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation with partners investing US$125 million and coordinating with the World Health Organization, the COVID-19 Therapeutics Accelerator began in March, facilitating drug development researchers to rapidly identify, assess, develop, and scale up potential treatments.
targetString: Iholwa yi-Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation nabalingane abatshale imali eyizigidi ezingu-US$125 futhi abaxhumene ne-World Health Organization, i-COVID-19 Therapeutics Accelerator yaqala ngo-March, yahlela abacwaningi abaklama umuthi ukuba basheshe bathole, bahlole, basungule, futhi bahlaziye imithi engasetshenziswa.

sourceString: The COVID-19 Clinical Research Coalition formed to coordinate and expedite results from international clinical trials on the most promising post-infection treatments.
targetString: I-COVID-19 Clinical Research Coalition yakhiwa ukuze ixhumanise futhi kusheshiswe imiphumela esuka ocwaningweni lwezokwelapha lwakwamanye amazwe ekwelashweni kwangemva kokungenwa igciwane okwethenjwayo.

sourceString: In early 2020, numerous established antiviral compounds for treating other infections were being repurposed or developed in new clinical research efforts to alleviate the illness of COVID-19.
targetString: Ngasekuqaleni kuka-2020, imithi elwa negciwane eminingana esunguliwe yokwelapha amanye amagciwane abesetshenziswa kabusha noma esungulwa emizamweni emisha yocwaningo lwezokwelapha ukuze kuncishiswe isifo se-COVID-19.

sourceString: For an already-approved drug (such as hydroxychloroquine for malaria), Phase III-IV trials determine in hundreds to thousands of COVID-19-infected people the possible extended use of an already-approved drug for treating COVID-19 infection.
targetString: Kumuthi osugunyaziwe kakade (njenge-hydroxychloroquine yomalaleveva), ucwaningo Lwesigaba III-IV lubona kubantu abangamakhulu ukuya ezinkulungwaneni abanegciwane le-COVID-19 ukusetshenziswa okweluliwe komuthi osugunyaziwe kakade ekwelapheni igciwane le-COVID-19.

sourceString: As of early April 2020, 103 candidate therapeutics were in preclinical or a stage of Phase I-IV development, with trial results for 29 drug candidates expected during April.
targetString: Kusukela ekuqaleni kuka-April 2020, amakhendidethi angu-103 asiza ekwelapheni abesekusungulweni kwangaphambi kokwelashwa noma esitejini Sesigaba I-IV, futhi imiphumela yocwaningo yamakhendidethi angu-29 omuthi ibilindelwe phakathi no-April.

sourceString: In March, the World Health Organization (WHO) launched the coordinated "Solidarity trial" in 10 countries to rapidly assess in thousands of COVID-19 infected people the potential efficacy of existing antiviral and anti-inflammatory agents not yet evaluated specifically for COVID-19 illness.
targetString: Ngo-March, i-World Health Organization (WHO) yasungula "Ucwaningo oluyimbumba" oluhlanganyelwayo emazweni angu-10 ukuze kusheshe kuhlolwe kubantu abayizinkulungwane abanegciwane le-COVID-19 ukusebenza kwama-ejenti alwa negciwane atholakalayo nadambisayo abengakahlolelwa ngokukhethekile ukugula kwe-COVID-19.

sourceString: Do any of the drugs reduce mortality?
targetString: Ingabe ikhona imithi enciphisa abantu abafayo?

sourceString: Do any of the drugs reduce the time a patient is hospitalized?
targetString: Ingabe ikhona imithi enciphisa isikhathi isiguli esilaliswa ngaso esibhedlela?

sourceString: Do the treatments affect the need for people with COVID-19-induced pneumonia to be ventilated or maintained in intensive care?
targetString: Ingabe ukwelashwa kuyasithinta isidingo sokuba abantu abanenyumoniya edalwe yi-COVID-19 bahlolwe noma bagcinwe benakekelwa ngokucophelela?

sourceString: Could such drugs be used to minimize the illness of COVID-19 infection in healthcare staff and people at high risk of developing severe illness?Enrolling people with COVID-19 infection is simplified by using data entries, including informed consent, on a WHO website.
targetString: Ingabe imithi enjalo ingasetshenziselwa ukunciphisa ukugula kwegciwane le-COVID-19 ezisebenzini zezempilo nakubantu abasengozini enkulu yokuba nesifo esibi? Ukubhalisa abantu abanegciwane le-COVID-19 kwenziwa lula ngokusebenzisa idatha egciniwe, okubandakanya imvume enolwazi, kuwebusayithi ye-WHO.

sourceString: After the trial staff determines the drugs available at the hospital, the WHO website randomizes the hospitalized subject to one of the trial drugs or to the hospital standard of care for treating COVID-19.
targetString: Ngemva kokuba izisebenzi zocwaningo sezithole imithi etholakalayo esibhedlela, iwebusayithi ye-WHO iqokela ngokungahleliwe umuntu osesibhedlela umuthi owodwa wocwaningo noma indlela evamile yokwelapha i-COVID-19.

sourceString: The trial physician records and submits follow-up information about the subject status and treatment, completing data input via the WHO Solidarity website.
targetString: Udokotela wocwaningo urekhoda futhi athumele ulwazi lokulandelela ngesimo sesiguli nokwelashwa kwaso, agcwalise idatha ngewebusayithi ye-WHO Solidarity.

sourceString: A global safety monitoring board of WHO physicians examine interim results to assist decisions on safety and effectiveness of the trial drugs, and alter the trial design or recommend an effective therapy.
targetString: Ibhodi yokuqapha ukuphepha emhlabeni wonke yodokotela be-WHO ihlola imiphumela ukuze isize ezinqumweni zokuphepha nokusebenza kwemithi yocwaningo, futhi ishintshe umklamo wocwaningo noma isikisele ukwelashwa okusebenzayo.

sourceString: A similar web-based study to Solidarity, called "Discovery", was initiated in March across seven countries by INSERM (Paris, France).During March, funding for the Solidarity trial reached US$108 million from 203,000 individuals, organizations and governments, with 45 countries involved in financing or trial management.
targetString: Ucwaningo olufanayo olusekelwe kuwebhu Oluhlanganyelwayo, olubizwa ngokuthi yi-"Discovery", lwasungulwa ngo-March emazweni ayisikhombisa yi-INSERM (eParis, eFrance). sourceString: Both drugs have extensive interactions with prescription drugs, affecting the therapeutic dose and disease mitigation.
targetString: Yomibili imithi isebenza ngendlela ephawulekayo nemithi enikezwa ngodokotela, ithinte umthamo wokwelashwa nokudamba kwesifo.

sourceString: Some people have allergic reactions to these drugs.On 12 April, a preliminary clinical trial conducted at a hospital in Brazil was stopped when several people given high doses of chloroquine for COVID-19 infection developed irregular heart rates, causing 11 deaths.

sourceString: It is unclear yet whether conditions arising during pregnancy including diabetes, cardiac failure, hypercoagulability or hypertension might represent additional risk factors for pregnant people as they do for nonpregnant people.From the limited data available, vertical transmission during the third trimester probably does not occur, or only occurs very rarely.

sourceString: There is no data yet on early pregnancy.
targetString: Ayikho idatha okwamanje ekukhulelweni kwangaphambi kwesikhathi.

targetString: Buncane ubufakazi obutholakalayo bokuvunyelwa kwanoma iziphi iziphetho eziqinile ngohlobo lwegciwane le-COVID-19 ekukhulelweni.

sourceString: A case series of 43 women from New York who tested positive for COVID-19 showed similar patterns to non-pregnant adults: 86% had mild disease, 9.3% had severe disease and 4.7% developed critical disease.
targetString: Izigameko zabesifazane abangu-43 baseNew York abatholakala bephozithivu lapho kuhlolwa i-COVID-19 babonisa amaphethini afanayo nawabantu abadala abangakhulelwe: u-86% wawunesifo esingesibi kangako, u-9.3% wawunesifo esibi kakhulu kanti u-4.7% waba nesifo esibucayi.

sourceString: Fetal distress was reported in two.
targetString: Kwabikwa ukuphatheka kabi kombungu kwababili.

sourceString: None of the women developed severe COVID-19 pneumonia or died.
targetString: Akekho kulaba besifazane owaba nenyumoniya ye-COVID-19 embi kakhulu pneumonia noma owafa.

sourceString: All of them had live birth pregnancies and no severe neonatal asphyxia was observed.

sourceString: The samples of breast milk, amniotic fluid, cord blood and neonatal throat swab were tested for SARS-CoV-2, and all results were negative.In another study on 15 pregnant women, majority of the patients presented with fever and cough, while laboratory tests yielded lymphocytopenia in 12 patients.

sourceString: Computed tomography findings of these patients were consistent with previous reports of non-pregnant patients, consisting of ground-glass opacities at early stage.

sourceString: Follow-up images after delivery showed no progression of pneumonia.Media reports indicate that over 100 women with COVID-19 might have delivered, and in March 2020, no maternal deaths were reported.

sourceString: Their guidelines thus advise that any pregnant person admitted to hospital with a COVID-19 infection should receive at least 10 days of prophylactic low-molecular-weight heparin after being discharged from the hospital.

sourceString: There are no data yet concerning the implications of COVID-19 infections for labour.
targetString: Ayikabikho idatha ehlobene nemiphumela yegciwane le-COVID-19 ekubeletheni.

sourceString: One infant girl born to a mother with COVID-19 had elevated IgM levels two hours after birth, suggesting that she had been infected in utero and supporting the possibility of vertical transmission in some cases.
targetString: Olunye usana oluyintombazane lukamama one-COVID-19 lwakhushukelwa amazinga e-IgM emahoreni amabili ngemva kokubelethwa, okusikisela ukuthi luthole igciwane esibelethweni futhi kwasekela namathuba okudluliselwa kwesifo kwezinye izimo.

sourceString: A small study involving 6 confirmed COVID-19 mothers showed no indication of SARS-COV-19 in their newborns' throats or serum but antibodies were present in neonatal blood sera samples, including IgM in two of the infants.
targetString: Ucwaningo oluncane oluhilela omama abangu-6 abane-COVID-19 alubonisanga uphawu lwe-SARS-COV-19 emiphinjeni yezinsana noma embungwini kodwa izakhi zesifo zazikhona kumasampula egazi lombungu, okubandakanya i-IgM ezinsaneni ezimbili.

sourceString: This is not usually passed from mother to fetus so further research is required to know whether the virus crossed the placenta or whether placentas of women in the study were damaged or abnormal.

sourceString: Since COVID-19 shows similarities to SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, it is likely that their effect on pregnancy are similar.

sourceString: None of the newborns were infected with SARS-CoV.
targetString: Azikho izinsana ezathola igciwane le-SARS-CoV.

sourceString: The outcome was favorable in a majority of the cases, but the infant death rate was 27%.A recent review suggested that COVID-19 appeared to be less lethal to mothers and infants than SARS and MERS but that there may be an increased risk of preterm birth after 28 weeks' gestation.

sourceString: The World Health Organization and  Centers for Disease Control and Prevention of the United States advises pregnant women to do the same things as the general public to avoid infection, such as covering cough, avoid interacting with sick people, cleaning hands with soap and water or sanitizer.

sourceString: People expecting their first baby were more willing to have online consultation and guidance than who had previously given birth.The RCOG and RCM recommend that in-person appointments be deferred by 7 days after the start of symptoms of COVID-19 or 14 days if another person in the household has symptoms.

sourceString: In the UK, official recommendations state that precautionary separation of a mother and a healthy baby should not be undertaken lightly and that they should be kept together in the postpartum period where neonatal care is not required.Literature from China recommended separation of infected mothers from babies for 14 days.

sourceString: b'COVID-19 surveillance involves monitoring the spread of the coronavirus disease in order to establish the patterns of disease progression.
targetString: Ukuqapha i-b'COVID-19 kuhilela ukuqapha ukubhebhetheka kwegciwane le-coronavirus ukuze kusungulwe amaphethini okubhebhetheka kwegciwane.

sourceString: The World Health Organization (WHO) recommends active surveillance, with focus of case finding, testing and contact tracing in all transmission scenarios.
targetString: I-World Health Organization (WHO) isikisela ukuqapha ngezenzo, okugxile ekutholeni abanegciwane, ukuhlola nokulandelela kuzo zonke izimo zokudluliseleka kwegciwane.

sourceString: COVID-19 surveillance is expected to monitor epidemiological trends, rapidly detect new cases, and based on this information, provide epidemiological information to conduct risk assessment and guide disease preparedness.
targetString: Ukuqashwa kwe-COVID-19 kulindeleke ukuba kubheke imikhuba yokulandelelwa kwegciwane, kusheshe kuthole abasha abathole igciwane, futhi ngokusekelwe kulolu lwazi, kunikeze ulwazi lokulandelelwa kwegciwane ukuze kuqhutshwe ukuhlolwa kwezingozi futhi kuqondise ukulungela ukusingatha igciwane.

sourceString: Syndromic surveillance is done based on the symptoms of an individual that corresponds to COVID-19.
targetString: Ukulandelelwa kwesifo kwenziwa ngokusekelwe ezimpawini zesifo zomuntu ezifuze eze-COVID-19.

sourceString: As of March 2020, the WHO recommends the following case definitions:
targetString: Kusukela ngo-March 2020, i-WHO incoma lezi zimo ezilandelayo zegciwane:

sourceString: Probable case : "A suspect case for whom testing for the COVID-19 virus is inconclusive" OR "a suspect case for whom testing could not be performed for any reason".
targetString: Isimo esiyizinsolo: "Isimo esiyizinsolo lapho ukuhlolwa kwegciwane le-COVID-19 kungenaziphetho eziqinisekile" NOMA "isimo esiyizinsolo lapho ukuhlolwa kwegciwane kungenakwenziwa nganoma isiphi isizathu".

sourceString: Confirmed case: "A person with laboratory confirmation of COVID-19 infection, irrespective of clinical signs and symptoms".
targetString: Isimo esiqinisekisiwe: "Umuntu onesiqinisekiso saselabhorethri sokuba negciwane le-COVID-19, kungakhathaliseki ukuthi ziyini izimpawu zesifo zezokwelashwa".

sourceString: Direct physical contact with a probable or confirmed case;
targetString: Ukuthintana okuqondile nomuthi okunezinsolo noma okunesiqinisekiso sokuthi unegciwane;

sourceString: Direct care for a patient with probable or confirmed COVID-19 disease without using proper personal protective equipment;
targetString: Ukunakekelwa ngokuqondile kwesiguli okunezinsolo noma okunesiqinisekiso sokuthi unesifo se-COVID-19 ngaphandle kokusetshenziswa kwezinto zokusebenza ezivikelayo ezifanele;

sourceString: Other situations as indicated by local risk assessments".WHO recommends reporting of probable and confirmed cases of COVID-19 infection within 48 hours of identification.
targetString: Ezinye izimo njengoba kuboniswe ukuhlola ubungozi endaweni". I-WHO isikisela ukubika kwezimo eziyizinsolo noma iziqinisekiso zegciwane le-COVID-19 phakathi namahora angu-48 selitholakele.

sourceString: The countries should report on a case-by-case basis as far as possible, but in case of limitation in resources, aggregate weekly reporting is also possible.
targetString: Amazwe kufanele abike isimo ngasinye uma kungenzeka, kodwa uma izinto zokusebenza zingekho, ukubika iviki ngalinye nakho kungenziwa.

sourceString: Some organizations have created crowdsourced apps for syndromic surveillance, where people can report their symptoms to help researchers map areas with concentration of COVID-19 symptoms.
targetString: Ezinye izinhlangano ziye zasungula ama-app okungabhala kuwo abantu abaningi ukuze kulandelelwe igciwane, lapho abantu bengabika izimpawu zabo zesifo ukuze basize abacwaningi bathole izindawo ezinabantu abaningi abanezimpawu zesifo se-COVID-19.

sourceString: Virological surveillance is done by using molecular tests for COVID-19.
targetString: Ukuthungathwa kwegciwane kwenziwa ngokusebenzisa ukuhlolwa kwamamolekhuli e-COVID-19.

sourceString: WHO has published resources for laboratories on how to perform testing for COVID-19.
targetString: I-WHO ishicilele ulwazi lwamalabhorethri lwendlela yokuhlolela i-COVID-19.

sourceString: In the European Union, laboratory confirmed cases of COVID-19 are reported within 24 hours of identification.
targetString: Ku-European Union, izimo eziqinisekiswe elabhorethri ze-COVID-19 zibikwa phakathi namahora angu-24 ngemva kokuba zitholiwe.

sourceString: At least 24 countries have established digital surveillance of their citizens.
targetString: Okungenani amazwe angu-24 ashicilele izindlela eziyidijithali zokulandelela izakhamuzi zazo.

sourceString: The digital surveillance technologies include apps, location data and electronic tags.
targetString: Ubuchwepheshe bokulandelela okuyidijithali buhlanganisa ama-app, idatha yendawo namathegi obuchwepheshe.

sourceString: The Center For Disease Control and Prevention in USA tracks the travel information of individuals using airline passenger data.
targetString: ISikhungo se-Disease Control and Prevention e-USA silandelela ulwazi lohambo lwabantu ngokusebenzisa idatha yabagibeli bezindiza.

sourceString: In Hong Kong, authorities are requiring a bracelet and an app for all travellers.
targetString: EHong Kong, iziphathimandla zifuna ibhengela ne-app kubo bonke abagibeli.

sourceString: A GPS app is used to track the locations of individuals in South Korea to ensure against quarantine breach, sending alerts to the user and to authorities if people leave designated areas.

sourceString: In Singapore, individuals have to report their locations with photographic proof.
targetString: ESingapore, abantu kufanele babike izindawo abakuzo ngobufakazi besithombe.

sourceString: Thailand is using an app and SIM cards for all travelers to enforce their quarantine.
targetString: EThailand kusetshenziswa i-app namakhadi e-SIM kubo bonke abagibeli ukuze kuqinisekiswe ukuthi bahlaliswa bodwa.

sourceString: Human rights organizations have criticized some of these measures, asking the governments not to use the pandemic as a cover to introduce invasive digital surveillance.
targetString: Izinhlangano zamalungelo abantu zigxeke ezinye zalezi zindlela, zacela ohulumeni ukuba bangasebenzisi umqedazwe njengesivikelo sokusungula izindlela zokulandelela eziyidijithali ezingafanele.

sourceString: b'Coronaviruses are a group of related viruses that cause diseases in mammals and birds.
targetString: Ama-b'Coronaviruses ayiqembu lamagciwane ahlobene abangela izifo ezilwaneni nasezinyonini.

sourceString: In humans, coronaviruses cause respiratory tract infections that can range from mild to lethal.
targetString: Kubantu, ama-coronavirus abangela amagciwane omgudu wokuphefumula asukela kwavamile kuya kwabulalayo.

sourceString: Mild illnesses include some cases of the common cold (which has other possible causes, predominantly rhinoviruses), while more lethal varieties can cause SARS, MERS, and COVID-19.
targetString: Izifo ezivamile zihlanganisa izimo ezithile zomkhuhlane ovamile (ezinezinye izimbangela, ikakhulukazi ama-rhinoviruses), kanti amagciwane abulalayo angabangela i-SARS, i-MERS, ne-COVID-19.

sourceString: Symptoms in other species vary: in chickens, they cause an upper respiratory tract disease, while in cows and pigs they cause diarrhea.
targetString: Izimpawu zesifo kwezinye izinto eziphilayo ziyahlukahluka: ezinkukhwini, zibangela isifo engxenyeni engenhla yomgudu wokuphefumula, kuyilapho ezinkomeni nasezingulubeni zibangela isifo sohudo.

sourceString: There are yet to be vaccines or antiviral drugs to prevent or treat human coronavirus infections.
targetString: Ayikabikho imigomo noma imithi yokwelapha yokuvimbela noma yokwelapha amagciwane e-coronavirus kubantu.

sourceString: Coronaviruses constitute the subfamily Orthocoronavirinae, in the family Coronaviridae, order Nidovirales, and realm Riboviria.
targetString: Ama-coronavirus ayingxenye yomndeni omncane we-Orthocoronavirinae, emndenini we-Coronaviridae, uhlelo lwe-Nidovirales, nomhlaba we-Riboviria.

sourceString: They are enveloped viruses with a positive-sense single-stranded RNA genome and a nucleocapsid of helical symmetry.
targetString: Angamagciwane avalekile anezakhi zofuzo ze-RNA ye-positive-sense ne-single-stranded kanye ne-nucleocapsid ye-helical symmetry.

sourceString: The genome size of coronaviruses ranges from approximately 26 to 32 kilobases, one of the largest among RNA viruses.
targetString: Usayizi wezakhi zofuzo wama-coronavirus usukela cishe kumakhilobheyisi angu-26 kuya kwangu-32, elinye lamagciwane amakhulu kunawo wonke kuma-RNA.

sourceString: They have characteristic club-shaped spikes that project from their surface, which in electron micrographs create an image reminiscent of the solar corona from which their name derives.
targetString: Anezinto ezicijile ezimise okwenduku yegalofu eziphuma ngaphakathi, lapho ama-electron micrographs akha khona isithombe esifana ne-solar corona okuyilapho kuvela khona igama lawo.

sourceString: Coronaviruses were first discovered in the 1930s when an acute respiratory infection of domesticated chickens was shown to be caused by infectious bronchitis virus (IBV).
targetString: Ama-coronavirus atholwa okokuqala ngawo-1930 lapho igciwane elihlobene nokuphefumula elinamandla lezinkukhu ezifuywayo kwatholwa ukuthi libangelwa yi-infectious bronchitis virus (IBV).

sourceString: In the 1940s, two more animal coronaviruses, mouse hepatitis virus (MHV) and transmissible gastroenteritis virus (TGEV), were isolated.Human coronaviruses were discovered in the 1960s.
targetString: Ngawo-1940, amanye ama-coronavirus amabili ezilwane, i-mouse hepatitis virus (MHV) ne-transmissible gastroenteritis virus (TGEV), ahlukaniswa. Ama-coronavirus abantu atholakala ngawo-1960.

sourceString: The earliest ones studied were from human patients with the common cold, which were later named human coronavirus 229E and human coronavirus OC43.
targetString: Awokuqala acwaningwa ayevela ezigulini ezingabantu ezinomkhuhlane ovamile, kamuva abizwa ngokuthi ama-human coronavirus 229E nama-human coronavirus OC43.

sourceString: They were first imaged by Scottish virologist June Almeida at St. Thomas Hospital in London.
targetString: Isithombe sawo sakhishwa okokuqala uchwepheshe wamagciwane waseScotland uJune Almeida eSt. Thomas Hospital eLondon.

sourceString: Other human coronaviruses have since been identified, including SARS-CoV in 2003, HCoV NL63 in 2004, HKU1 in 2005, MERS-CoV in 2012, and SARS-CoV-2 in 2019.
targetString: Amanye ama-coronavirus abantu aye atholwa kusukela lapho, okubandakanya i-SARS-CoV ngo-2003, i-HCoV NL63 ngo-2004, i-HKU1 ngo-2005, i-MERS-CoV ngo-2012, ne-SARS-CoV-2 ngo-2019.

sourceString: Most of these have involved serious respiratory tract infections.
targetString: Iningi lalawa liye labandakanya amagciwane omgudu wokuphefumula amabi kakhulu.

sourceString: The name was first used in 1968 by an informal group of virologists in the journal Nature to designate the new family of viruses.
targetString: Igama lasetshenziswa okokuqala yiqembu elikhululekile lama-virologist ngo-1968 kumagazini i-Nature ukuze kuhlukaniswe uhlobo olusha lwamagciwane.

sourceString: The name refers to the characteristic appearance of virions (the infective form of the virus) by electron microscopy, which have a fringe of large, bulbous surface projections creating an image reminiscent of a crown or of a solar corona.
targetString: Leli gama libhekisela ezicini zokubukeka zama-virions (isimo sokuba yigciwane) ngesibonakhulu sama-electron, anamaphethelo akhipha izinto ezingamabhamuza amakhulu, akha isithombe somqhele noma i-corona eyilanga.

sourceString: This morphology is created by the viral spike peplomers, which are proteins on the surface of the virus.
targetString: Lesi simo sakhiwa ama-peplomers aciijle egciwane, angamaphrotheni ebusweni begciwane.

sourceString: Coronaviruses are large pleomorphic spherical particles with bulbous surface projections.
targetString: Ama-coronavirus ayizinhlayiya ezinkulu eziyindilinga ze-pleomorphic ezinobuso obukhipha amabhamuza.

sourceString: The envelope of the virus in electron micrographs appears as a distinct pair of electron dense shells.The viral envelope consists of a lipid bilayer where the membrane (M), envelope (E) and spike (S) structural proteins are anchored.
targetString: Imvilophu yegciwane kuma-electron micrographs ibonakala ingamagobongo awugqinsi e-electron. Imvilophu yegciwane iqukethe ulwelwesi olukabili lwe-lipid lapho i-membrane (M), i-envelope (E) namaphrotheni abukeka ene-spike (S) ikhona.

sourceString: The lipid bilayer envelope, membrane proteins, and nucleocapsid protect the virus when it is outside the host cell.
targetString: Imvilophu ewulwelwesi olukabili ye-lipid, amaphrotheni e-membrane, ne-nucleocapsid kuvikela igciwane lapho lingaphandle kweseli eliqukethwe kulo.

sourceString: Coronaviruses contain a positive-sense, single-stranded RNA genome.
targetString: Ama-coronavirus aqukethe izakhi zofuzo eziphozithivu, ze-RNA eyi-single-stranded.

sourceString: The genome size for coronaviruses ranges from 26.4 to 31.7 kilobases.
targetString: Usayizi wezakhi zofuzo zama-coronavirus usukela kumakhilobheyisi angu-26.4 uye kwangu-31.7.

sourceString: The genome size is one of the largest among RNA viruses.
targetString: Usayizi wezakhi zofuzo uphakathi kwamakhulu kunawo wonke kumagciwane e-RNA.

sourceString: The open reading frames 1a and 1b, which occupy the first two-thirds of the genome, encode the replicase/transcriptase polyprotein.
targetString: Amafreyimu afundeka evuliwe ka-1a no-1b, aqukethwe ezingxenyeni zokuqala ezimbili kwezintathu zezakhi zofuzo, abhala ngekhodi i-replicase/transcriptase polyprotein.

sourceString: The replicase/transcriptase polyprotein self cleaves to form nonstructural proteins.The later reading frames encode the four major structural proteins: spike, envelope, membrane, and nucleocapsid.
targetString: I-replicase/transcriptase polyprotein iyahlukana ukuze kwakheke amaphrotheni angenasakhiwo. Amafreyimu akamuva abhala ngekhodi amaphrotheni amane amakhulu: i-spike, i-envelope, i-membrane, ne-nucleocapsid.

sourceString: Interspersed between these reading frames are the reading frames for the accessory proteins.
targetString: Okusakazeke phakathi kwalawa mafreyimu amafreyimu afundekayo amaphrotheni ensiza.

sourceString: The number of accessory proteins and their function is unique depending on the specific coronavirus.
targetString: Inani lamaphrotheni ensiza nomsebenzi wawo kuhlukile kuye nge-coronavirus ngayinye.

sourceString: Infection begins when the viral spike (S) glycoprotein attaches to its complementary host cell receptor.
targetString: Ukungenwa igciwane kuqala lapho i-viral spike (S) glycoprotein inamathela ku-complementary host cell receptor yayo.

sourceString: After attachment, a protease of the host cell cleaves and activates the receptor-attached spike protein.
targetString: Ngemva kokunamathela, i-protease yeseli eyinhloko iyahlukana futhi isebenzisa i-receptor-attached spike protein.

sourceString: Depending on the host cell protease available, cleavage and activation allows the virus to enter the host cell by endocytosis or direct fusion of the viral envelop with the host membrane.On entry into the host cell, the virus particle is uncoated, and its genome enters the cell cytoplasm.
targetString: Kuye nge-protease yeseli eyinhloko etholakalayo, ukuhlukana nokusebenza kuvumela igciwane ukuba ingene kuseli eyinhloko nge-endocytosis noma ngokuhlangana ngokuqondile kwe-viral envelop nolwelwesi oluyinhloko. Lapho lingena kuseli eyinhloko, igcinwane liyavuleka, futhi izakhi zalo zingena ku-cytoplasm yeseli.

sourceString: The host ribosome translates the initial overlapping open reading frame of the virus genome and forms a long polyprotein.
targetString: I-ribosome eyinhloko iguqula ukushiyana kokuqala kwefreyimu efundeka ivulekile yezakhi zegciwane futhi yakhe i-polyprotein ende.

sourceString: The polyprotein has its own proteases which cleave the polyprotein into multiple nonstructural proteins.
targetString: I-polyprotein inama-proteases ayo ahlukana ne-polyprotein abe amaphrotheni amaningi angenasakhiwo.

sourceString: A number of the nonstructural proteins coalesce to form a multi-protein replicase-transcriptase complex (RTC).
targetString: Amaphrotheni amaningana angenasakhiwo ayahlangana ukuze akhe i-replicase-transcriptase complex (RTC) yamaphrotheni amaningi.

sourceString: The main replicase-transcriptase protein is the RNA-dependent RNA polymerase (RdRp).
targetString: Iphrotheni eliyinhloko le-replicase-transcriptase yi-RNA-dependent RNA polymerase (RdRp).

sourceString: It is directly involved in the replication and transcription of RNA from an RNA strand.
targetString: Lihileleke ngokuqondile ekukhiqizweni nakubhalweni kabusha kwe-RNA kusukela engxenyaneni ye-RNA.

sourceString: The other nonstructural proteins in the complex assist in the replication and transcription process.
targetString: Amanye amaphrotheni angenasakhiwo asiza enqubweni yokwenza ikhophi nokuhlela kabusha.

sourceString: The exoribonuclease nonstructural protein, for instance, provides extra fidelity to replication by providing a proofreading function which the RNA-dependent RNA polymerase lacks.One of the main functions of the complex is to replicate the viral genome.
targetString: Iphrotheni elingenasakhiwo le-exoribonuclease, ngokwesibonelo, linikeza ukunemba okwengeziwe ekwenzeni ikhophi ngokunikeza umsebenzi wokufundeka i-RNA-dependent RNA polymerase engenako. Enye yezinto ezibalulekile ezenziwa yi-complex iwukwenza ikhophi yezakhi zegciwane.

sourceString: RdRp directly mediates the synthesis of negative-sense genomic RNA from the positive-sense genomic RNA.
targetString: I-RdRp ihlela ngokuqondile ukuhlangana kwe-negative-sense genomic RNA ukusuka ku-positive-sense genomic RNA.

sourceString: This is followed by the replication of positive-sense genomic RNA from the negative-sense genomic RNA.
targetString: Lokhu kulandelwa ukwenziwa kwekhophi ye-positive-sense genomic RNA ukusuka ku-negative-sense genomic RNA.

sourceString: The other important function of the complex is to transcribe the viral genome.
targetString: Omunye umsebenzi osemqoka we-complex uwukubhala kabusha izakhi zegciwane.

sourceString: RdRp directly mediates the synthesis of negative-sense subgenomic RNA molecules from the positive-sense genomic RNA.
targetString: I-RdRp ihlela ngokuqondile ukuhlangana kwamamolekhuli e-negative-sense subgenomic RNA ukusuka ku-positive-sense genomic RNA.

sourceString: This is followed by the transcription of these negative-sense subgenomic RNA molecules to their corresponding positive-sense mRNAs.
targetString: Lokhu kulandelwa ukubhalwa kabusha kwalawa mamolekhuli e-negative-sense subgenomic RNA ukuya ku-positive-sense mRNAs ehambelanayo.

sourceString: The replicated positive-sense genomic RNA becomes the genome of the progeny viruses.
targetString: I-positive-sense genomic RNA enekhophi iba isakhi samagciwane afanayo.

sourceString: The mRNAs are gene transcripts of the last third of the virus genome after the initial overlapping reading frame.
targetString: Ama-mRNA awukubhalwa kabusha kwezakhi zofuzo eziyingxenye yokugcina kwezintathu zezakhi zegciwane ngemva kwefreyimu efundwayo yokuqala.

sourceString: These mRNAs are translated by the host's ribosomes into the structural proteins and a number of accessory proteins.
targetString: Lawa ma-mRNA abhalwa ama-ribosome ayinhloko abe amaphrotheni ayisakhiwo namaphrotheni ayizinsiza amaningana.

sourceString: RNA translation occurs inside the endoplasmic reticulum.
targetString: Ukubhalwa kwe-RNA kwenzeka ngaphakathi kwe-endoplasmic reticulum.

sourceString: The viral structural proteins S, E, and M move along the secretory pathway into the Golgi intermediate compartment.
targetString: Amaphrotheni ayisakhiwo segciwane S, E, ne-M ahamba ngasemzileni okhiqizayo angene ku-Golgi intermediate compartment.

sourceString: There, the M proteins direct most protein-protein interactions required for assembly of viruses following its binding to the nucleocapsid.
targetString: Lapho, ama-M proteins aqondisa ukusebenzelana okuningi kwamaphrotheni okudingekayo ukuze amagciwane ahlangane ngemva kokuhlangana ne-nucleocapsid.

sourceString: Progeny viruses are then released from the host cell by exocytosis through secretory vesicles.
targetString: Amagciwane afanayo abe esekhishwa kuseli eyinhloko yi-exocytosis ngama-secretory vesicles.

sourceString: The interaction of the coronavirus spike protein with its complement host cell receptor is central in determining the tissue tropism, infectivity, and species range of the virus.
targetString: Ukusebenza kwephrotheni elicijile le-coronavirus ne-receptor yeseli elihambisana nalo eliyinhloko kusemqoka ekutholeni i-tissue tropism, ububi begciwane, nohlobo lwegciwane.

sourceString: The SARS coronavirus, for example, infects human cells by attaching to the angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2) receptor.
targetString: I-SARS coronavirus, ngokwesibonelo, ingena kumaseli abantu ngokunamathela ku-angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2) receptor.

sourceString: The scientific name for coronavirus is Orthocoronavirinae or Coronavirinae.
targetString: Igama lesayensi le-coronavirus yi-Orthocoronavirinae noma i-Coronavirinae.

sourceString: Coronaviruses belong to the family of Coronaviridae, order Nidovirales, and realm Riboviria.
targetString: Ama-coronavirus ayingxenye yomndeni wama-Coronaviridae, uhlelo lwama-Nidovirales, nomhlaba wama-Riboviria.

sourceString: Genus Betacoronavirus; type species: Murine coronavirus
targetString: Genus Betacoronavirus; uhlobo: Murine coronavirus

sourceString: Species: Betacoronavirus 1 (Bovine Coronavirus, Human coronavirus OC43), Human coronavirus HKU1, Murine coronavirus, Pipistrellus bat coronavirus HKU5, Rousettus bat coronavirus HKU9, Severe acute respiratory syndrome-related coronavirus (SARS-CoV, SARS-CoV-2), Tylonycteris bat coronavirus HKU4, Middle East respiratory syndrome-related coronavirus, Hedgehog coronavirus 1 (EriCoV)
targetString: Uhlobo: i-Betacoronavirus 1 (i-Bovine Coronavirus, i-Human coronavirus OC43), i-Human coronavirus HKU1, i-Murine coronavirus, i-Pipistrellus bat coronavirus HKU5, i-Rousettus bat coronavirus HKU9, i-Severe acute respiratory syndrome-related coronavirus (SARS-CoV, SARS-CoV-2), i-Tylonycteris bat coronavirus HKU4, i-Middle East respiratory syndrome-related coronavirus, i-Hedgehog coronavirus 1 (EriCoV)

sourceString: Species: Beluga whale coronavirus SW1, Infectious bronchitis virus
targetString: Uhlobo: i-Beluga whale coronavirus SW1, i-Infectious bronchitis virus

sourceString: The most recent common ancestor (MRCA) of all coronaviruses is estimated to have existed as recently as 8000 BCE, although some models place the common ancestor as far back as 55 million years or more, implying long term coevolution with bat and avian species.
targetString: I-most recent common ancestor (MRCA) yawo wonke ama-coronavirus ilinganiselwa ukuthi ibilokhu ikhona kusukela ngo-8000 BCE, nakuba amanye amamodeli abeka i-common ancestor emuva le eminyakeni eyizigidi ezingu-55 edlule noma ngaphezulu, okusho ukuthi sekukade iguquka ngezinhlobo zamalulwane nezinyoni.

sourceString: The most recent common ancestor of the alphacoronavirus line has been placed at about 2400 BCE, the betacoronavirus line at 3300 BCE, the gammacoronavirus line at 2800 BCE, and the deltacoronavirus line at about 3000 BCE.
targetString: I-most recent common ancestor yama-alphacoronavirus ibekwe cishe ku-2400 BCE, i-betacoronavirus ku-3300 BCE, i-gammacoronavirus ku-2800 BCE, kanti i-deltacoronavirus ku-3000 BCE.

sourceString: The large number of host bat and avian species, and their global range, has enabled extensive evolution and dissemination of coronaviruses.Many human coronavirus have their origin in bats.
targetString: Inani elikhulu lamalulwane ayinhloko nezinhlobo zezinyoni, kanye nokutholakala kwawo emhlabeni, kuvumele ukuguquka okukhulu nokusakazeka kwama-coronavirus. Ama-coronavirus amaningi abantu anomsuka wamalulwane.

sourceString: More recently, alpaca coronavirus and human coronavirus 229E diverged sometime before 1960.
targetString: Muva nje, i-alpaca coronavirus ne-human coronavirus 229E yahlukana cishe ngaphambi kuka-1960.

sourceString: MERS-CoV emerged in humans from bats through the intermediate host of camels.
targetString: I-MERS-CoV yavela kubantu isuka kumalulwane ngamakamela.

sourceString: MERS-CoV, although related to several bat coronavirus species, appears to have diverged from these several centuries ago.
targetString: I-MERS-CoV, nakuba ihlobene nezinhlobo eziningana ze-coronavirus yamalulwane, kubonakala yahlukana nalawa eminyakeni eminingana edlule.

sourceString: The most closely related bat coronavirus and SARS-CoV diverged in 1986.
targetString: I-coronavirus yamalulwane esondelene kakhulu ne-SARS-CoV yahlukana ngo-1986.

sourceString: A possible path of evolution, of SARS coronavirus and keen bat coronaviruses, suggests that SARS related coronaviruses coevolved in bats for a long time.
targetString: Umzila wokuguquka ongaba khona, we-SARS coronavirus nama-coronavirus elulwane, usikisela ukuthi ama-coronavirus e-SARS aguquka kumalulwane isikhathi eside.

sourceString: In the 1790s, equine coronavirus diverged from the bovine coronavirus after a cross-species jump.
targetString: Ngawo-1790, i-equine coronavirus yahlukana ku-bovine coronavirus ngemva kokushintsha kwezinhlobo.

sourceString: Later in the 1890s, human coronavirus OC43 diverged from bovine coronavirus after another cross-species spillover event.
targetString: Kamuva ngo-1890, i-human coronavirus OC43 yashintsha ekubeni yi-bovine coronavirus ngemva kwesinye isigameko sokuguquka kohlobo.

sourceString: It is speculated that the flu pandemic of 1890 may have been caused by this spillover event, and not by the influenza virus, because of the related timing, neurological symptoms, and unknown causative agent of the pandemic.
targetString: Kucatshangwa ukuthi umqedazwe womkhuhlane ngo-1890 kungenzeka wabangelwa yilesi sigameko, futhi hhayi igciwane lemfuluwenza, ngenxa yesikhathi esihlobene, izimpawu zesifo ekusebenzeni kwezinzwa, kanye ne-ejenti engaziwa eyimbangela yomqedazwe.

sourceString: Human coronavirus OC43 besides causing respiratory infections is also suspected of playing a role in neurological diseases.
targetString: I-Human coronavirus OC43 ngaphandle kokubangela amagciwane okuphefumula isolwa nangokuba nendima ezifweni zezinzwa.

sourceString: In the 1950s, the human coronavirus OC43 began to diverge into its present genotypes.
targetString: Ngawo-1950, i-human coronavirus OC43 yaqala ukuhlukana yaba izinhlobo zezakhi zamanje.

sourceString: Phylogentically, mouse hepatitis virus (Murine coronavirus), which infects the mouse's liver and the central nervous system, is related to  human coronavirus OC43 and bovine coronavirus.
targetString: Ngokuguquka, igciwane le-hepatitis yamagundane (i-Murine coronavirus), ebangela igciwane esibindini nakusistimu yezinzwa yegundane, lihlobene ne-human coronavirus OC43 ne-bovine coronavirus.

sourceString: Human coronavirus HKU1, like the aforementioned viruses, also has its origins in rodents.
targetString: I-coronavirus yabantu i-HKU1, njengamanye amagciwane asebiziwe, nayo futhi inomsuka okumagundwane.

sourceString: Coronaviruses vary significantly in risk factor.
targetString: Ama-coronavirus ahlukahluka kakhulu endabeni yobungozi.

sourceString: Some can kill more than 30% of those infected, such as MERS-CoV, and some are relatively harmless, such as the common cold.
targetString: Amanye angabulala abangaphezu kuka-30% balabo abangenwe igciwane, njenge-MERS-CoV, futhi amanye awayona ingozi kangako, njengomkhuhlane ovamile.

sourceString: Coronaviruses can cause colds with major symptoms, such as fever, and a sore throat from swollen adenoids.
targetString: Ama-coronavirus angabangela umkhuhlane onezimpawu zesifo ezimbi kakhulu, njengemfiva, kanye nomphimbo obuhlungu ngenxa yokuvuvuka kwama-adenoid.

sourceString: Coronaviruses can cause pneumonia (either direct viral pneumonia or secondary bacterial pneumonia) and bronchitis (either direct viral bronchitis or secondary bacterial bronchitis).
targetString: Ama-coronavirus angabangela inyumoniya (kungaba inyumoniya eyigciwane eliqondile noma inyumoniya yesibili eyigciwane) ne-bronchitis (kungaba i-bronchitis eyigciwane eliqondile noma i-bronchitis eyigciwane lesibili).

sourceString: The human coronavirus discovered in 2003, SARS-CoV, which causes severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS), has a unique pathogenesis because it causes both upper and lower respiratory tract infections.Six species of human coronaviruses are known, with one species subdivided into two different strains, making seven strains of human coronaviruses altogether.
targetString: I-human coronavirus eyatholwa ngo-2003, i-SARS-CoV, ebangela i-severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS), ine-pathogenesis ehlukile ngoba ibangela amagciwane omgudu wokuphefumula ongenhla nongezansi. Kunezinhlobo eziyisithupha zama-human coronavirus ezaziwayo, futhi uhlobo olulodwa luhlukene lwaba izingxenye ezimbili ezihlukene, okwakha izingxenye eziyisikhombisa zama-human coronavirus esewonke.

sourceString: Four of these coronaviruses continually circulate in the human population and produce the generally mild symptoms of the common cold in adults and children worldwide: -OC43, -HKU1, HCoV-229E, -NL63.
targetString: Amane alawa ma-coronavirus aqhubeka ejikeleza esibalweni somuntu futhi akhiqiza izimpawu ezingezimbi ngokuvamile zomkhuhlane ovamile kubantu abadala nasezinganeni emhlabeni wonke: -OC43, -HKU1, HCoV-229E, -NL63.

sourceString: Coronaviruses cause about 15% of commons colds.
targetString: Ama-coronavirus abangela cishe u-15% wemikhuhlane evamile.

sourceString: The majority of colds are caused by rhinoviruses.
targetString: Iningi lemikhuhlane libangelwa ama-rhinoviruses.

sourceString: The four mild coronaviruses have a seasonal incidence occurring in the winter months in temperate climates.
targetString: Ama-coronavirus amane angemabi anesenzakalo senkathi yonyaka esenzeka ezinyangeni zasebusika ezimweni zezulu ezikahle.

sourceString: There is no preference towards a particular season in tropical climates.
targetString: Ayikho inkathi yonyaka engcono ezimweni zezulu ezikahle.

sourceString: Four human coronaviruses produce symptoms that are generally mild:
targetString: Ama-human coronavirus amane akhiqiza izimpawu zesifo ezingezimbi ngokuvamile:

sourceString: The virus was officially named the SARS coronavirus (SARS-CoV).
targetString: Igciwane labizwa ngokomthetho ngokuthi yi-SARS coronavirus (SARS-CoV).

sourceString: More than 8,000 people were infected, about ten percent of whom died.
targetString: Bangaphezu kuka-8,000 abantu abangenwa igciwane, cishe amaphesenti angaba yishumi abo afa.

sourceString: In September 2012, a new type of coronavirus was identified, initially called Novel Coronavirus 2012, and now officially named Middle East respiratory syndrome coronavirus (MERS-CoV).
targetString: Ngo-September 2012, kwatholwa uhlobo olusha lwe-coronavirus, ekuqaleni lwabizwa ngokuthi yi-Novel Coronavirus 2012, futhi manje ibizwa ngokusemthethweni ngokuthi yi-Middle East respiratory syndrome coronavirus (MERS-CoV).

sourceString: The World Health Organization issued a global alert soon after.
targetString: I-World Health Organization yakhipha isixwayiso somhlaba wonke ngokushesha ngemva kwalokho.

sourceString: The WHO update on 28 September 2012 said the virus did not seem to pass easily from person to person.
targetString: Isibuyekezo se-WHO ngomhla ka-28 September 2012 sathi igciwane alibonakalanga lidlula kalula ukusuka kumuntu liye komunye.

sourceString: However, on 12 May 2013, a case of human-to-human transmission in France was confirmed by the French Ministry of Social Affairs and Health.
targetString: Nokho, ngomhla ka-12 May 2013, kwatholakala ukudluliselwa kwalo lisuka kumuntu liya komunye eFrance kwaqinisekiswa yi-French Ministry of Social Affairs and Health.

sourceString: In addition, cases of human-to-human transmission were reported by the Ministry of Health in Tunisia.
targetString: Ngaphezu kwalokho, izigameko zokudluliselwa kwalo lisuka kumuntu liya komunye zabikwa uMnyango Wezempilo eTunisia.

sourceString: Two confirmed cases involved people who seemed to have caught the disease from their late father, who became ill after a visit to Qatar and Saudi Arabia.
targetString: Izigameko ezimbili eziqinisekisiwe zazihilela abantu okwabonakala bethole leli gciwane kubaba wabo owayengasekho, owagula ngemva kokuvakashela eQatar naseSaudi Arabia.

sourceString: Despite this, it appears the virus had trouble spreading from human to human, as most individuals who are infected do not transmit the virus.
targetString: Naphezu kwalokhu, kubonakala sengathi leli gciwane alidlulanga kalula ukusuka kumuntu liya komunye, ngoba abantu abaningi abanegciwane abalidlulisi igciwane.

sourceString: The final name for the virus is Middle East respiratory syndrome coronavirus (MERS-CoV).
targetString: Igama okwaphethwa ngalo legciwane yi-Middle East respiratory syndrome coronavirus (MERS-CoV).

sourceString: The only U.S. cases (both survived) were recorded in May 2014.In May 2015, an outbreak of MERS-CoV occurred in the Republic of Korea, when a man who had traveled to the Middle East, visited four hospitals in the Seoul area to treat his illness.
targetString: Izigameko okuwukuphela kwazo e-U.S. (bobabili abantu basinda) zarekhodwa ngo-May 2014. Ngo-May 2015, kwaqubuka i-MERS-CoV eRepublic of Korea, lapho umlisa owayesohambweni oluya eMiddle East, avakashela izibhedlela ezine eSeoul ukuze elaphe ukugula kwakhe.

sourceString: This caused one of the largest outbreaks of MERS-CoV outside the Middle East.
targetString: Lokhu kwabangela okunye kokuqubuka okukhulu kunakho konke kwe-MERS-CoV ngaphandle kweMiddle East.

sourceString: As of December 2019, 2,468 cases of MERS-CoV infection had been confirmed by laboratory tests, 851 of which were fatal, a mortality rate of approximately 34.5%.
targetString: Kusukela ngo-December 2019, abantu abangu-2,468 ababenegciwane le-MERS-CoV babeqinisekiswe ngokuhlola kwaselabhorethri, abangu-851 bagcina befile, okwaba isilinganiso sabangaba ngu-34.5% sabantu abafa.

sourceString: In December 2019, a pneumonia outbreak was reported in Wuhan, China.
targetString: Ngo-December 2019, kwabikwa ukuqubuka kwenyumoniya eWuhan, eChina.

sourceString: On 31 December 2019, the outbreak was traced to a novel strain of coronavirus, which was given the interim name 2019-nCoV by the World Health Organization (WHO), later renamed SARS-CoV-2 by the International Committee on Taxonomy of Viruses.
targetString: Ngomhla ka-31 December 2019, lokhu kuqubuka kwatholakala ukuthi kuwuhlobo olusha lwe-coronavirus, okwanikezwa igama ngaleso sikhathi elithi 2019-nCoV yi-World Health Organization (WHO), kamuva kwabizwa ngokuthi yi-SARS-CoV-2 yi-International Committee on Taxonomy of Viruses.

sourceString: Some researchers have suggested the Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market may not be the original source of viral transmission to humans.As of 17 April 2020, there have been at least 153,822 confirmed deaths and more than 2,240,191 confirmed cases in the coronavirus pneumonia pandemic.
targetString: Abanye abacwaningi basikisela ukuthi i-Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market kungenzeka ayiwona umthombo wokuqala wokudluliselwa kwegciwane kubantu. Kusukela ngomhla ka-17 April 2020, sekuqinisekiswe ukufa okungenani kwabantu abangu-153,822 nabantu abangaphezu kuka-2,240,191 abaqinisekisiwe kulo mqedazwe wenyumoniya ye-coronavirus.

sourceString: The Wuhan strain has been identified as a new strain of Betacoronavirus from group 2B with approximately 70% genetic similarity to the SARS-CoV.
targetString: Leli gciwane laseWuhan kuthiwa liyigciwane elisha le-Betacoronavirus elivela eqenjini 2B elinokufana okungaba ngu-70% kwezakhi ne-SARS-CoV.

sourceString: The virus has a 96% similarity to a bat coronavirus, so it is widely suspected to originate from bats as well.
targetString: Leli gciwane linokufana okungu-96% ne-coronavirus yamalulwane, ngakho abaningi basola ukuthi livela nasemalulwaneni.

sourceString: The pandemic has resulted in travel restrictions and nationwide lockdowns in several countries.
targetString: Umqedazwe uphumele ekuvinjelweni kwezihambi nama-lockdown kazwelonke emazweni amaningi.

sourceString: Coronaviruses have been recognized as causing pathological conditions in veterinary medicine since the 1930s.
targetString: Ama-coronavirus aye abhekwa njengabangela igciwane ezilwaneni kusukela ngo-1930s.

sourceString: Except for avian infectious bronchitis, the major related diseases have mainly an intestinal location.
targetString: Ngaphandle kwe-avian infectious bronchitis, izifo ezinkulu ezihlobene yilezo eziba sendaweni yamathumbu.

sourceString: Coronaviruses primarily infect the upper respiratory and gastrointestinal tract of mammals and birds.
targetString: Ama-coronavirus ngokuyinhloko abangela igciwane emgudwini ongenhla wokuphefumula nomgudu oxhumene osuka emlonyeni uya ezinqeni wezilwane nezinyoni.

sourceString: They also cause a range of diseases in farm animals and domesticated pets, some of which can be serious and are a threat to the farming industry.
targetString: Aphinde abangele izinhlobo zamagciwane ezilwaneni ezifuywayo emaphandleni nasezindlini, ezinye zazo zingaba zimbi kakhulu futhi ziwusongo embonini yezolimo.

sourceString: In chickens, the infectious bronchitis virus (IBV), a coronavirus, targets not only the respiratory tract but also the urogenital tract.
targetString: Ezinkukhwini, i-infectious bronchitis virus (IBV), i-coronavirus, ayihlaseli kuphela umgudu wokuphefumula kodwa futhi nomgudu womchamo.

sourceString: The virus can spread to different organs throughout the chicken.
targetString: Igciwane lingabhebhetheka ezithweni ezihlukene kuyo yonke inkukhu.

sourceString: Economically significant coronaviruses of farm animals include porcine coronavirus (transmissible gastroenteritis coronavirus, TGE) and bovine coronavirus, which both result in diarrhea in young animals.
targetString: Ama-coronavirus adala umonakalo emafamu ahlanganisa i-porcine coronavirus (i-transmissible gastroenteritis coronavirus, TGE) ne-bovine coronavirus, futhi womabili abangela isifo sohudo ezilwaneni ezisencane.

sourceString: Feline coronavirus: two forms, feline enteric coronavirus is a pathogen of minor clinical significance, but spontaneous mutation of this virus can result in feline infectious peritonitis (FIP), a disease associated with high mortality.
targetString: I-Feline coronavirus: izinhlobo ezimbili, i-feline enteric coronavirus iyi-pathogen enobungozi obuncane kwezokwelashwa, kodwa ukuhlangana okungazelelwe kwale gciwane kungaphumela ku-feline infectious peritonitis (FIP), isifo esihlobene namazinga aphakeme okufa.

sourceString: Similarly, there are two types of coronavirus that infect ferrets: Ferret enteric coronavirus causes a gastrointestinal syndrome known as epizootic catarrhal enteritis (ECE), and a more lethal systemic version of the virus (like FIP in cats) known as ferret systemic coronavirus (FSC).
targetString: Ngendlela efanayo, kunezinhlobo ezimbili ze-coronavirus angena kuma-ferret: I-ferret engena ku-coronavirus ibangela igciwane lomgudu osuka emlonyeni uya ezinqeni elaziwa ngokuthi yi-epizootic catarrhal enteritis (ECE), nohlelo lwegciwane olubulala nakakhulu (njenge-FIP emakatini) olwaziwa ngokuthi yi-ferret systemic coronavirus (FSC).

sourceString: There are two types of canine coronavirus (CCoV), one that causes mild gastrointestinal disease and one that has been found to cause respiratory disease.
targetString: Kunezinhlobo ezimbili ze-canine coronavirus (CCoV), lolo olubangela igciwane elingelibi lomgudu osuka emlonyeni uya ezinqeni nalelo elitholakele elibangela isifo sokuphefumula.

sourceString: Mouse hepatitis virus (MHV) is a coronavirus that causes an epidemic murine illness with high mortality, especially among colonies of laboratory mice.
targetString: I-mouse hepatitis virus (MHV) iyi-coronavirus ebangela isifo samagundane esiqumqedazwe esibulala abantu abaningi, ikakhulukazi phakathi kwezinhlobo zamagundane aselabhorethri.

sourceString: Sialodacryoadenitis virus (SDAV) is highly infectious coronavirus of laboratory rats, which can be transmitted between individuals by direct contact and indirectly by aerosol.
targetString: I-sialodacryoadenitis virus (SDAV) iyi-coronavirus eyigciwane elibulalayo lamagundane aselabhorethri, elingadluliseleka phakathi kwabantu ngokuthintana ngokuqondile nangokuhogela.

sourceString: Some strains of MHV cause a progressive demyelinating encephalitis in mice which has been used as a murine model for multiple sclerosis.
targetString: Ezinye izinhlobo ze-MHV zibangela i-demyelinating encephalitis edlondlobalayo emagundaneni eye yasetshenziswa njengemodeli yomchamo ku-multiple sclerosis.

sourceString: Significant research efforts have been focused on elucidating the viral pathogenesis of these animal coronaviruses, especially by virologists interested in veterinary and zoonotic diseases.
targetString: Imizamo emikhulu yocwaningo iye yagxiliswa ekucaciseni indlela yokwakheka kwegciwane lama-coronavirus alezi zilwane, ikakhulu abahlaziyi bamagciwane abanesifiso sokwazi ngamagciwane ezilwane nadluliselwa esuka ezilwaneni aye kubantu.

sourceString: Porcine coronavirus (transmissible gastroenteritis coronavirus of pigs, TGEV).
targetString: I-porcine coronavirus (i-transmissible gastroenteritis coronavirus of pigs, TGEV).

sourceString: Bovine coronavirus (BCV), responsible for severe profuse enteritis in of young calves.
targetString: I-bovine coronavirus (BCV), enegalelo ekuvuvukaleni okubi kwamathumbu ematholeni.

sourceString: Feline coronavirus (FCoV) causes mild enteritis in cats as well as severe Feline infectious peritonitis (other variants of the same virus).
targetString: I-feline coronavirus (FCoV) ibangela ukuvuvukala kwamathumbu okungekubi emakatini kanye ne-Feline infectious peritonitis (ezinye izinhlobo zegciwane elifanayo) embi kakhulu.

sourceString: the two types of canine coronavirus (CCoV) (one causing enteritis, the other found in respiratory diseases).
targetString: izinhlobo ezimbili ze-canine coronavirus (CCoV) (olunye lubangela ukuvuvukala kwamathumbu, olunye lutholakala emagciwaneni okuphefumula).

sourceString: Turkey coronavirus (TCV) causes enteritis in turkeys.
targetString: I-Turkey coronavirus (TCV) ibangela ukuvuvukala kwamathumbu kumagalikuni.

sourceString: Ferret enteric coronavirus causes epizootic catarrhal enteritis in ferrets.
targetString: I-Ferret enteric coronavirus ibangela ukuvuvukala kwamagciwane kwe-epizootic catarrhal kuma-ferrets.

sourceString: Ferret systemic coronavirus causes FIP-like systemic syndrome in ferrets.
targetString: I-Ferret systemic coronavirus ibangela igciwane elinjenge-FIP kuma-ferrets.

sourceString: Rabbit enteric coronavirus causes acute gastrointestinal disease and diarrhea in young European rabbits.
targetString: I-Rabbit enteric coronavirus ibangela isifo esibi somgudu osuka emlonyeni uya ezinqeni nohudo konogwaja abancane base-Europe.

sourceString: Porcine epidemic diarrhea virus (PED or PEDV), has emerged around the world.
targetString: Igciwane le-Porcine epidemic diarrhea (i-PED noma i-PEDV), iye yaqubuka emhlabeni wonke.
